
## Summary Statistics of Abalones' - Dimensional Measurements

```{r results = "asis"}
library(arsenal)

tab1 <- 
  tableby(~ length + diameter + height, 
          data=abalone)

summary(tab1)
```

## Plot of Abalone Age by wholeWeight

```{r}
library(dplyr)
abalone <- abalone %>%
  mutate(age = rings + 1.5)

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(abalone,
       aes(x=wholeWeight, 
           y=age)) +
  geom_point() +
  # add loess smoothed line
  geom_smooth() + 
  xlab("Whole Weight (g)") + 
  ylab("Age (in years)") + 
  ggtitle("Abalone Age by Whole Weight")
```

## Plot of Abalone Age by diameter - by sex

Create a plot of abalone age by diameter in mm. Show the plot by sex - either add a color by sex or a facet_wrap().

```{r}
# put your code here
# option 1 color points by sex
ggplot(abalone,
       aes(x = diameter, 
           y = age,
           color = sex)) +
  geom_point() +
  # add loess smoothed line
  geom_smooth() + 
  xlab("Diameter (mm)") + 
  ylab("Age (in years)") + 
  ggtitle("Abalone Age by Whole Weight")

# option 2 facet_wrap() by sex
ggplot(abalone,
       aes(x = diameter, 
           y = age)) +
  geom_point() +
  # add loess smoothed line
  geom_smooth() + 
  xlab("Diameter (mm)") + 
  ylab("Age (in years)") + 
  ggtitle("Abalone Age by Whole Weight") +
  facet_wrap(vars(sex))
```
